name: Zoom Kobe 6 Protro 'Grinch'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 6 Protro ‘Grinch’ brings back a beloved colorway initially released in 2010 as part of the Nike Basketball Christmas Day Collection. Updated with contemporary Zoom Air cushioning technology, the sneaker features the eye-catching aesthetic of the original, highlighted by a vibrant green finish on the upper. Polyurethane ‘islands’ cover the synthetic upper, mimicking the texture of snakeskin while also providing added durability.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 Protro 'Mambacita Sweet Sixteen'
description:
The Nike Kobe 6 Protro 'Mambacita Sweet Sixteen' pays tribute to Kobe Bryant and his daughter Gigi. Black snake scales on the upper reference Bryant's Black Mamba alter ego. Notes of white appear on the Swoosh, tongue logo and leather back panels. The heel mold swaps out the traditional Kobe signature for the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation crest, with "Kobe" and "Gigi" inscribed on the left and right shoe, respectively. A gilded "2" on the lateral window represents Gigi's AAU uniform number. The insoles further honor Gigi with a design that features angel wings, a halo, the nickname "Mambacita" and another "2."

GOAT is donating net proceeds on the sale of this item to organizations providing under-resourced communities with footwear.

name: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'Hall Of Fame'
model: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'Hall Of Fame'
description: The Undefeated x Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘Hall of Fame’ celebrates Kobe Bryant’s induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. As a nod to the Mamba’s championship pedigree, a metallic gold finish coats the upper, crafted from breathable mesh with snakeskin-textured leather overlays. Each shoe is accented with a purple Swoosh on the right side panel and a mismatched pink Swoosh on the left. Specific to the left shoe, the pink Swoosh is inscribed with the numbers 24, 10 and 8, representing the jersey numbers that Kobe wore with the Lakers and Team USA. Additional mismatched branding lands on the tongue and heel, both featuring Kobe’s personal trademark and Undefeated’s Five Strikes logo.

Performance features include Flywire technology for a custom fit and a midsole with Zoom Air in the heel and forefoot for responsiveness.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘Bruce Lee’
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘Bruce Lee’ brings back a beloved 2010 colorway inspired by the martial artist whose style and mindset informed Kobe Bryant’s play on the hardwood. The yellow and black design — complete with red scratch marks on the lateral forefoot — give the nod to Bruce Lee’s jumpsuit from his iconic film ‘Enter the Dragon.’ In terms of performance, the lightweight build utilizes Nike’s Flywire technology throughout the upper, supported by a foam midsole housing a large-volume Zoom Air unit in the forefoot.

The most obvious nod to the event comes via the Blue Lagoon that covers the knit upper and translucent outsole, the latter revealing a white midsole. A gold ‘X’ is emblazoned on the bottom of the sole, with Kobe’s signature appearing across the tongue in red.

Constructed with a lightweight knit build, the low-top is finished in a patriotic red, white and blue color scheme. Nods to Kobe Bryant arrive on the heels, including four stitch marks on the left heel as an allusion to the four feet of sutures used in Bryant’s 2013 Achilles surgery. The numbers ‘08’ and ‘12’ are embroidered on the right heel, representing the Olympic years in which Kobe won gold medals with the US Men’s National Team.

Inside the low-top, a dual-layer memory foam sockliner provides a custom fit.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Purple Stardust'
description: Emerging in a new colorway with Los Angeles Lakers DNA, the Nike Kobe A.D. features a ‘Purple Stardust’ colorway with a mesh upper. Blocked with tonal suede paneling on the heel, the design is contrasted with a black outsole and branding, while the midsole is displayed with a detailed speckle pattern. The insole is stamped with yellow Mamba logos to complete the look.

name: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'What If Pack' Special Box
model: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'What If Pack' Special Box
description: Designed in partnership with the LA-based retailer, the Undefeated x Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘What If Pack’ brings together two colorways inspired by Kobe Bryant’s selection in the 1996 NBA Draft. The first pair features various hues taken from the 12 teams that passed on the Mamba, while the second is dressed in the colors of the Charlotte Hornets, the franchise that took the 17-year-old high schooler with the 13th pick. Both are accented with metallic gold detailing that celebrates Bryant’s five championships.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'Big Stage'
description: The Nike Kobe 5 Protro 'Big Stage' gets its name from the shoe that Kobe Bryant wore during the 2010 NBA Finals, which culminated in the Mamba clinching his fifth and final championship with the Lakers. The design combines ‘home’ and ‘away’ editions of the ‘Big Stage’ Kobe 5 with graphic elements borrowed from the ‘Parade’ PE, which cover the lateral side of the left shoe and medial side of the right. Contrasting pops of metallic gold appear on the sneaker’s heel and branding hits.

name: Kobe 6 GS 'Grinch'
description: The Nike Kobe 6 GS ‘Grinch’ was officially named the ‘Green Mamba,’ but its Christmas Day 2010 debut and colorway reminiscent of the iconic curmudgeon led fans to dub it the ‘Grinch.’ The bright green coloring on the shoe’s upper is complemented by a scaly reptilian texture, reflective of Nike’s intention for the design to be a nod to the green mamba—a variation on Kobe’s ‘Black Mamba’ nickname.

Kobe’s signature is printed on the molded heel counter, while his personal logo adorns the tongue.

name: Kobe 11 'Fundamental'
description: The Kobe 11 EM Low ‘Fundamental’ showcases an understated colorway, featuring a white Engineered Mesh upper accented by Cool Grey Flywire technology and a black Swoosh. Underfoot, the low-profile sneaker comes with a full-length drop-in Lunarlon midsole, dense foam at the heel and an icy blue translucent outsole.

description: A PE colorway made for San Antonio’s DeMar DeRozan, the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘DeMar DeRozan’ features a neutral palette consistent with the Spurs’ signature palette. The sneaker’s lightweight synthetic upper is covered in a blend of checkerboard and zebra patterns, both rendered in subdued grey and white tones. A glossy black finish is applied to the Nike Swoosh, matching the heel counter marked with Kobe Bryant’s signature.

name: Kobe 11 'Carpe Diem'
description: The colorway on this Kobe 11 was originally popularized by the Kobe 4 ‘Carpe Diem’ in 2009 which is credited for kickstarting the transition to low-top footwear on the court. Seven years later, Nike reran the iconic look on this Kobe 11, giving it the same Lakers color scheme, grid stitching along the interior, and translucent sole.

The shoe’s look is completed by a translucent outsole.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro '5 Rings'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘5 Rings’ brings back a celebratory Kobe 5 colorway that originally launched in summer 2010 in recognition of the Mamba’s fifth championship with the Los Angeles Lakers. The low-top makes use of a simple palette in Concord and Midwest Gold, executed on a streamlined upper covered in various graphics centered around the number 5. A gradient two-tone midsole packs Zoom Air cushioning in both the heel and forefoot.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro '5x Champ'
description: Launching as part of a special commemorative collection honoring the memory of Kobe Bryant, the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘5x Champ’ features a design inspired by the championship jackets gifted to the Mamba following his second and third NBA titles. The glossy patent leather upper is dressed in purple and black with contrasting gold accents. The Lakers’ signature purple and gold hues are repeated on the LA-themed custom sockliner.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'Alternate Bruce Lee'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘Alternate Bruce Lee’ pays homage to the iconic martial artist with a design that takes its cues from the 2010 colorway inspired by Lee’s jumpsuit from ‘Enter the Dragon.’ The black and white color scheme adds yellow accents in a nod to the original, along with the distinctive red scratch marks on the lateral forefoot. While the original Zoom Kobe 5 featured Zoom Air cushioning in the forefoot and heel, this pair utilizes a large-volume Zoom Air unit only in the forefoot.

Released in October 2016, the colorway was part of Nike's 'Black Space' pack that also included blacked out colorways for the KD 9 and LeBron Soldier 10 silhouettes.

name: Kobe 9 Elite 'Victory'
description: Released in conjunction with Kobe Bryant’s return for the 2014 season after achilles surgery, the Nike Kobe 9 Elite features a bright metallic volt Flyknit upper with underlying black accents, while the Mamba branding and Swoosh are accented with gold tones. The sock-liner provides a snug and adaptable feel, while the Flywire lacing system enhances forefoot support and stability.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Mighty I.T.' PE
description: Nike released an exclusive colorway to celebrate the return of Cleveland Cavaliers point guard Isaiah Thomas following his hip injury. The Kobe A.D. 'Mighty I.T.' PE features a Cavaliers-inspired color scheme with a Gym Red upper and University Gold details on the mini jewel-like Swoosh on the sides and on the branded tongue. The sneaker also boasts trademark “I.T” initials on the heel counter, an icy iridescent outsole, and a graphic on the insoles.

It features a snake-textured polyurethane upper with black accents across the tongue, lacing, and heel atop a white Zoom cushioned midsole and blue outsole.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 'Grinch'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 6 ‘Grinch’ launched Christmas Day in 2010, featuring a Green Apple colorway that calls to mind to the Dr. Seuss character with a penchant for ruining everyone’s famous December holiday. However the real inspiration behind this colorway is the deadly Green Mamba snake, with green scales and deep black eyes which can be seen on the scaly Mamba-inspired texture on the upper, with a contrasting black Swoosh. Red accents tie together the Christmas theme, highlighted with Kobe Bryant’s logo in red atop the tongue.

name: Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Wizenard'
description: Anticipating the NBA marquee matchups that define the holiday season, Nike released the Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Wizenard' in December 2019. The multi-colored vibe is inspired by the book cover of 'The Wizenard Series - Training Camp,' created by Kobe Bryant. A tumbled-leather tongue and matte black heel cap lend a refined look. Performance benefits stay intact from the original shoe created by Eric Avar, including Flywire, Lunarlon foam and Zoom Air cushioning.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 'All Star'
description: In conjunction with Nike’s LA All-Star Pack from 2011, the Zoom Kobe 6 All-Star iteration features a red and black color scheme to pay tribute to the West’s signature team colors. The shoe is equipped with the classic snakeskin texture throughout the upper, paying tribute to Kobe’s nickname, ‘Black Mamba.’ The shoe’s dual-layer memory foam sock-liner creates a personalized fit, while the Flywire construction provides support.

The Deep Garnett finish up top is complemented by Hyper Crimson underfoot.

name: Crazy 1 Kobe 'Stormtrooper' 2022
description: The adidas Crazy 1 ‘Stormtrooper’ brings back an OG colorway of the hoops shoe originally dubbed the Kobe 1, worn by Kobe Bryant during the 2000 – 2001 NBA season. The unconventional design features a molded synthetic upper in a crisp white finish, marked with debossed three-stripes on the quarter panel and contrasted by black mesh on the tongue and collar. The sneaker rides on a matching white EVA midsole, supported underfoot by a midfoot shank and herringbone-traction rubber outsole.

name: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'What If Pack - Unlucky 13'
model: Undefeated x Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'What If Pack - Unlucky 13'
description: Made in collaboration with the LA-based retailer, the Undefeated x Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro ‘Unlucky 13’ is taken from the two-piece ‘What If Pack,’ inspired by the circumstances surrounding Kobe Bryant’s selection and subsequent trade in the 1996 NBA draft. This pair features a white and teal color scheme that gives the nod to the Charlotte Hornets, the team that drafted Bryant with the 13th overall pick. Metallic gold Swooshes celebrate the Black Mamba's five championships.

name: Kobe A.D. NXT 360 'White Multicolor'
description: Released about two years after Kobe Bryant’s retirement from the NBA, the Black Mamba is still trying to get his signature sneaker to have maximum performance output for players that wear his Kobe line. The Kobe A.D. NXT 360 features a 360-degree white Flyknit upper with multicolor accents around the collar and a translucent orange heel. The sneaker also boasts a dual-density foam midsole with Nike React technology and Lunarlon underfoot. A Kobe-inspired pattern adorns the Emerald Green outsole.

description: Nike released a colorway inspired by the ancient Silk Road trade route between the East and the West. The Kobe 9 'Silk' arrives with an Engineered Mesh upper with patterns throughout that reference the Dunhuang murals in North Western China. The sneaker also boasts a golden Swoosh on the sidewall, a snake-like pattern on the mudguard and heel, and Merlot details on the tongue, heel, and laces.

name: Kobe 10 Elite 'Rose Gold'
description: The Nike Kobe 10 Elite unites three advanced technologies in a sophisticated, mid-top profile representative of Bryant's alter ego, Black Mamba. Launched in June 2015, this 'Rose Gold' variant supplies full-length support through an engineered mesh bootie and Flywire cables integrated into the laces. The legend's logo is cut into the tongue, with metallic Swooshes located on the sides. A translucent outsole encases the Lunarlon midsole.

name: Kobe 11 'Mambacurial'
description: The Nike Kobe 11 ‘Mambacurial’ sneaker features a breathable woven Flyknit fabrication and a gradient color scheme. Originally seen on the Kobe 8, the Pink Flash and Action Green combination quickly became one of the most coveted Kobe colorways, a nod to the Mercurial soccer boot that inspired the design. In this minimal low-top iteration, an oversized ‘NIKE’ logo decorates the medial side, with a mountain-like translucent Action Green overlay accenting the midsole.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Flip the Switch'
description: Introduced in May 2017, the Nike Kobe A.D. 'Flip the Switch' sneaker is primed for the NBA postseason with unique traits associated with Bryant's charge to the championship. The nubuck and synthetic upper flaunts a bold tongue, a fractured lateral Swoosh and an ombre external counter with a sheath logo. A coiled snake and script logo embroider the heel patches. Zoom Air, Lunarlon midsole cushioning and the rubber outsole remain.

name: Kobe A.D. 'White Ice'
description: Developed to Kobe Bryant’s specifications, Nike designers studied Bryant’s quick mentality and movements to create a premium shoe with high-performing features. Released in March 2018, the Kobe A.D. 'White Ice' sneaker comes in a mid-cut silhouette decked out in an ultralight multi-layered mesh upper. Locked down with Flywire cables above, below, Lunarlon foam and a Zoom Air unit provide optimal range in motion.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 Protro 'White Del Sol'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 6 Protro ‘White Del Sol’ brings back the original ‘POP’ colorway from 2011, updated with refreshed tooling and a sleeker shape. Polyurethane ‘islands’ create a scaly texture on the white and grey upper, fortified with a black molded heel counter and accented with a matching black Swoosh. The Cushlon midsole packs a large and flexible Air Zoom Turbo unit in the forefoot, along with a softer foam compound in the heel. Underfoot, the rubber outsole features a snakeskin-inspired traction pattern for maximum grip.

The looking is further accented by hits of Bright Crimson on the lining, Flywire cables and outsole, while support is provided by the speckled Lunarlon midsole.

name: Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Snakeskin'
description: Issued October 2019, the Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'FTB' revamps the Black Mamba's fourth signature shoe in dark reptilian detail and hits of color on a supple material build. An outlined Swoosh logo is embroidered in teal and gold, honoring the Hornets and Lakers. First designed by Eric Avar in 2008, this Nike hoops sneaker is full of performance benefits, including Flywire cables, Lunarlon cushioning and low-profile Zoom Air for a responsive ride.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Chrome'

The colorway sits above a midsole that’s equipped with Zoom Air, while a translucent blue outsole is featured underfoot. Kobe’s signature is embroidered in red on the right heel tab, and a DNA double helix emblem is featured on the left. An extra hit of grey on the upper arrives via the Swoosh.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 Protro 'Chaos'
description: Celebrating its 10th anniversary, the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 Protro returns in January 2020 with inspiration taken from DC Comics supervillain, the Joker. This 'Chaos' edition evokes the character's iconic suit in a multi-color, mixed-material upper flaunting lizard skin textures, flecked laces and a protective toe cap while neon branding recalls his green hair. The sneaker carries a splattered midsole and color-pop rubber outsole.

A ‘1997’ pull tab is affixed to the tongue, featuring an orange holographic badge that alternates between adidas and Feet You Wear branding. The white speckled midsole underfoot houses a Zoom Air unit in the heel, which acts in concert with a drop-in Lunarlon sockliner for lightweight cushioning.

name: Kobe 11 'Mamba Day' iD
description: The Kobe 11 'Mamba Day' iD was a limited release shoe that dropped during Kobe Bryant's final NBA game against the Utah Jazz on April 13th, 2016. The special edition NIKEiD shoe features a black Flyknit upper with a metallic gold Swoosh and a translucent ice-blue sole. The upper also features metallic gold graphics that highlight eight of Bryant's most impressive career stats. These include the dates of his first and last games (11.01.96 and 4.13.16), his five World Championships, his four All-Star MVP awards, his 18 All-Star appearances, his 81 points scored in a game, his 20 years in the NBA, and his jersey number '24.' Fans were also able to add a personal message on the inner tongue.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Bruce Lee'
description: Released in March 2016, the Nike Kobe 11 'Bruce Lee' features a yellow and black Flyknit upper inspired by the jumpsuit worn by Bruce Lee in his final film 'Game of Death.' The shoe also comes with an all-black sole and red scratch marks on the heel as a nod to Lee's wounds in the final fight in 'Enter the Dragon.' The Bruce Lee theme was also featured on the Zoom Kobe 5 in 2010.

name: Kobe AD Mid 'Baseline'
description: The ‘Baseline’ edition of the Kobe AD dresses the sneaker in shades of white and Court Purple, with a speckled motif marking the midsole. The mid-top silhouette has a lightweight, multilayer mesh upper and a Lunarlon-cushioned sole, while an engineered tread delivers traction on the court. Additional design touches can be seen on the embroidered triple-Swoosh branding and webbed collar, as well as on the molded Kobe emblems at the heels.

description: Introduced in 2013, Nike’s Zoom Kobe Venomenon 4 is a low top basketball sneaker designed for both indoor and outdoor courts. The shoe flaunts a Hyperfuse upper with flexible Flywire technology and Zoom Air cushioning in the midsole.

name: Kobe A.D. NXT 360 'Infrared'
description: While Kobe Bryant’s NBA career may be over, his signature A.D. line of Nike footwear continues to channel his on-court performance and quick-strike playing style. The Kobe A.D. NXT 360 'Infrared' has a Flyknit upper with a practically seamless construction across the silhouette. The edges of the outsole are equipped with Nike React foam for greater bounce, while Lunarlon cushioning adds even more comfort. Kobe’s signature appears on the silver heel counter.

name: Kobe 9 EM 'Easter'
description: The Nike Kobe 9 EM appears in another vibrant colorway featuring an Easter inspiration. The Engineered Mesh upper sports a marbled gradient in a Lucid Green tone with black accents. Complementing the vivid appearance are turquoise and steel segments on the midsole, while the tongue and sock-liner are contrasted with neon yellow swatches to pay homage to the tradition of dying colorful Easter eggs.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Easter'
description: In celebration of Easter 2016, Nike Basketball released a four-sneaker holiday pack that included colorways from signature players Kyrie Irving, Kevin Durant and LeBron James. The Kobe 11 'Easter' shows off a two-tone Flyknit upper with a gradient fade infused with Dark Grey and tropical Mango hues. A translucent outsole and embossed skull logo on the right heel add distinction to this special edition sneaker.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 'Military Blue'
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. 2018 sneaker reflects Kobe Bryant's off-court fashion game and masterful playing style. Introduced in February 2019, this 'Military Blue' is endowed with a breathable mesh and synthetic bootie. Personalized graphics on the pull tab, heel and cord lacing pay tribute to the Mamba's legendary career. A Zoom Air heel unit and an icy micro-blade outsole pattern provide next-generation performance.

name: Kobe 11 'Summer'
description: The Nike Kobe 11 EM Low 'Summer' features a colorway that hints at the colors of the country where Kobe Bryant grew up—Italy. The white engineered mesh upper has hits of green—albeit in an aqua tone that deviates from the traditional Italian version—on the Swoosh and collar, while an orange-red peeks out on the branding and lace loops. Below, the midsole-outsole comes in a gum rubber that wraps up the side for extra support.

name: N/A
description: The 1996 NBA Draft saw the Charlotte Hornets trade the 13th overall pick to the Los Angeles Lakers in exchange for center Vlade Divac. The Lakers would use that pick to select Kobe Bryant, and to pay tribute to those events, the Zoom Kobe 6 ‘Draft Day’ emerges in a Hornets-inspired colorway. The white snakeskin-textured upper is accented by a Varsity Purple Swoosh and laces, while Photo Blue emerges on the heel counter, lining and midsole.

name: Kobe 9 Elite Low 'Moonwalker'
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low appears with a Flyknit upper construction in a ‘Hyper Grape’ colorway to pay homage to the King of Pop. The translucent outsole is stamped with a moonrock graphic to reference Michael Jackson’s infamous Moonwalk performance. A carbon fiber midsole matches the tone of the black accents on the laces and sock-liner, while the silver Swoosh on the quarter-panel provides additional contrast.

name: Kobe A.D. 'University Red'
description: No longer taking the court in signature purple and gold, Kobe Bryant footwear evolves to showcase players that possess the Black Mamba mentality. The Nike Kobe A.D. emerges in a ‘University Red’ colorway on the mesh upper. The tonal Swoosh and branding are contrasted by a black sock-liner and outsole. Built for adaptability, the seamless forefoot design is complemented with a LunarLon cushioning system for a responsive shock absorption.

name: Kobe 9 Elite Premium 'What The Kobe'
description: Released in January 2015, the limited edition Nike Kobe 9 Elite “What The” incorporates previous Kobe 9 colorways into its multicolor Flyknit upper. The shoe also features reflective tonal graphics, a speckled grey midsole, and a print mélange on the inner collar.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Poison Dart Frog'
description: This Lakers-inspired colorway of the Zoom Kobe 7 is part of the ‘Poison Dart Frog’ pack from 2012. The design takes inspiration from both the amphibious animal and the Los Angeles-based NBA team, sporting a frog-print upper and frog icon in jersey colors of purple, yellow, and black.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Playoff'
description: The Nike Kobe 8 System ‘Playoff’ released in May 2013, during the NBA postseason. The performance basketball shoe is built with a tightly woven Engineered Mesh upper, adorned in a purple snakeskin print inspired by Kobe Bryant’s Black Mamba persona. A subtly speckled midsole houses a full-length Lunarlon unit for lightweight cushioning.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Invisibility Cloak'
description: Nicknamed the ‘Invisibility Cloak,’ this Nike Kobe 7 colorway features a chameleon-like iridescent upper that changes from Court Purple to Turquoise Blue, a honeycomb texture on the black tongue and heel, and an iridescent heel counter with Bryant’s signature. The low top also comes with a metallic silver Swoosh, Nike Zoom units in the forefoot and heel, and an icy blue translucent outsole with a black rubber herringbone insert on the forefoot.

name: Kobe A.D. Mid 'Passion'
description: The ‘Passion’ Kobe AD Mid is one of five different tonal offerings in the 2017 ‘Mamba Mentality’ Pack that pays tribute to Kobe Bryant’s time playing for the L.A. Lakers. While other colors in the series stand for traits like calmness and positivity, the red rendition represents passion for the game. Unique to the red variation, a signature print on the heel, toe, and collar completes the limited edition look.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Year of the Horse'
description: The Kobe 8 System ‘Year of the Horse’ dropped on New Year’s Day in 2014. Paying tribute to 2014 being the Year of the Horse, the low-top features a Light Crimson, Bright Citron and Vivid Blue colorway inspired by the colors most likely to bring luck in that year. It also features Kobe Bryant’s signature on the heel counter and a Lunarlon midsole for cushioning.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Black Mamba'
description: Inspired by Kobe Bryant’s notorious nickname on the hardwood, the Nike Kobe A.D. ‘Black Mamba’ is constructed with a mostly black upper that features a seamless application with a textured overlay. Blocked with University Gold tones throughout the branding and outsole, the shoe is also adorned with the phrase ‘Black Mamba’ written across the tongues in a Lakers font.

name: Kobe A.D. Exodus 'Green Strike'
description: Kobe Bryant and Nike have once again collaborated for the Kobe A.D. Exodus 'Green Strike' sneaker. Released in November 2018 as part of a seven-shoe pack, the Kobe A.D. features a light mesh upper with padded foam overlays and a motion-enhancing, low-cut collar. Flywire cables wrap around exterior and integrate into the lacing system. Draped in a split two-tone colorway, Kobe branding and a cushioned sole complete the sneaker.

description: The Kobe 9 brings a combination of Flywire and engineered mesh fabrics throughout the upper for a seamless design that strategically tightens and loosens when in motion. A Lunarlon cushioning system ensures long-lasting comfort, while the pressure mapped outsole pods are designed to increase traction on court.

name: Kobe 10 'Fundamentals'
description: Kobe’s tenth signature shoe alludes to the importance of fundamentals, adopting a simplistic white and black color scheme. Featuring a white mesh upper construction that adapts to the forefoot’s natural motion, contrast coloring arrives via the Swoosh and forefoot as well as the mismatched heel branding. The shoe is also layered with Lunarlon technology in the midsole for a responsive ride.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Grey Snakeskin'
description: A nod to Kobe Bryant’s ‘Black Mamba’ nickname, the Kobe A.D. ‘Grey Snakeskin’ sports a snakeskin upper with webbed paneling on the ankle and tongue. The triptych Swoosh is embroidered in a spectrum of red to orange, while similarly bright hues can be found on the insole. The heel counters are detailed with unique icons that appear to outline a complex arrangement of basketball plays.

name: Kobe 9 Elite 'Black History Month'
description: The 2015 Nike BHM Collection celebrates Black History Month with a collection of products across different sports that honors six athletes and coaches who have positively impacted sport with their courage and determination: Theotis Beasley, Kevin-Prince Boateng, Jerry Rice, Brianna Rollins, C. Vivian Stringer and John Thompson. The Kobe 9 Elite follows the black and white palette with a monochromatic appearance across the entire shoe. The Flyknit upper is split into two halves, with the lateral side featuring a mostly black look, and the medial side a mostly white look.

name: Undefeated x Kobe 4 Protro 'Fir'
description: The Undefeated x Kobe 4 Protro 'Giannis Antetokounmpo' gives a popular low-top silhouette first seen in 2008 an updated look and a colorway dominated with a solid green upper, a nod to Giannis' Milwaukee Bucks. Released in August 2019 on Mamba Day, this edition showcases Kobe's sheath logo on one tongue and the Undefeated logo on the other. The sneaker's patent leather upper displays the Swoosh in black, while Kobe's numbers, 8 and 24, appear on alternating heels. A white midsole and multi-colored outsole provide contrast.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 EP 'Vivid Purple'
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. EP ‘Deep Purple’—a late summer 2018 version of Kobe Bryant’s post-retirement signature shoe—resembles Kobe models of the past, with a low-cut silhouette and plenty of Kobe branding, but it also showcases newer elements including a white band across the forefoot, a set of significant numbers on the tongue lace loops and a wide lacing system. The lightweight upper combines black, purple and white with hints of yellow, while the sole adds gray and a few more pops of purple to complete this Laker-centric design.

name: Kobe 9 EM 'USA'
description: The Kobe 9 EM incorporates a patriotic motif to celebrate the Fourth of July, sporting an assortment of red, white and blue tones in a geometric print that appears throughout the entire Engineered Mesh upper. Red Flywire cables are included for a locked-down fit, while Lunarlon promotes a cushioned ride. An icy translucent outsole provides traction.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'All Star - Northern Lights'
model: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'All Star - Northern Lights'
description: February 2016 saw the release of Kobe Bryant's final All-Star Game sneaker, the Kobe 11 'All-Star.' Inspired by the Northern Lights, a nod to Toronto's status as host-city, the shoe features a black Flyknit upper with Green Glow and Persian Violet accents, silver Swoosh, sculpted heel, and a Green Glow and Persian Violet sole

name: Kobe 10 Elite 'Rivalry'
description: The ‘Chester’ edition of the Nike Kobe 10 is inspired by the orange jerseys of the high school rival team Bryant helped beat before leading his own to win a state title. Up top, a Flyknit upper is covered in dual orange tones and accentuated by a black toe box. The tribute continues underfoot with a white Zoom-cushioned midsole complemented by an orange translucent outsole.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 'Lower Merion Aces'
description: This Zoom Kobe 6 ‘Lower Merion Aces’ is a tribute Kobe Bryant’s alma mater, Philadelphia’s Lower Merion High School. Decked out in the school’s colors, the shoe combines Cool Grey and metallic platinum hues on its snakeskin textured upper alongside a Varsity Crimson Swoosh. The design also features a grey midsole with Zoom Air cushioning, a Pure Platinum outsole and the basketball team’s logo, the Aces, on the lateral heel.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Milk Snake'
description: The Nike Kobe 8 System taps into Kobe’s snake-like instincts on court with a ‘Milk Snake’ inspiration. The seamless engineered mesh upper comes dressed in a combination of red, black, and grey hues contrasted with a white midsole. Lunarlon cushioning provides advanced shock absorption when encountering harsh impact, while the glass composite shank enables greater stability for optimal performance.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Blue Poison Dart Frog'
model: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Blue Poison Dart Frog'
description: Resembling the colors of a poison dart frog, the Zoom Kobe 7 System features a black, Team Orange and Photo Blue color scheme that mimics the frog’s skin, while the tongue and collar implement premium leather panels. The external heel counter helps increase stability, while the Zoom Air in the midsole provides lightweight cushioning.

name: Kobe 11 'Sunset'
description: Paying tribute to Kobe Bryant’s final farewell from the NBA, the ‘Sunset’ edition of the Kobe 11 features a gradient application that fades from yellow to purple on the upper’s seamless Engineered Mesh. Serving as both a nod to vibrant L.A. skies and the idea of Kobe riding off into the sunset, the shoe also sports Flywire cables and a leather tongue. Reflective detailing finishes off the Swooshes.

name: Kobe 9 EM 'Laser Crimson'
description: With a colorway similar to the ‘Black Cement’ edition of the Jordan 3, the Kobe 9 EM features a black Engineered Mesh textile throughout the upper, with a midsole shank stamped with the iconic cement print. The contrasting Laser Crimson Flywire cables help create a locked-down fit while matching the color of the sockliner and Kobe branding.

The Kobe AD NXT 360 'Yellow Strike' draws from the Los Angeles Lakers’ color palette to produce a model with an all-yellow 360-degree Flyknit yellow upper, purple accents on the translucent cushioned outsole and tongue, light purple details on the heel clip, red logos at the heel, and large white Swooshes on the sides.

The school’s signature burgundy hue is applied to the engineered mesh upper, while ‘1996’ is inscribed in gold on the tongue tag — the year Kobe led the Aces to a state championship. Vibrant pops of Hyper Crimson stand out on the sneaker’s Flywire cables and rubber outsole.

The sneaker boasts a grey mesh upper with black mesh and grey leather accents. The low top also sports University Red details on the side Swoosh, tongue and heel branding, and tongue lining.

name: Kobe 8 System Elite 'Superhero'
description: Designed to celebrate Kobe Bryant’s otherworldly talents on the court, the Kobe 8 System Elite ‘Superhero’ features a Poison Green engineered mesh weave upper with Dynamic Flywire technology in the forefoot for structure. The sneaker also boasts a speckled heel counter, a carbon fiber shank, 3M detailing throughout, an articulated foam tongue, and a Lunarlon midsole for added cushioning.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 'Chaos'
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. 2018 ‘Chaos’ continues a distinctive design theme that’s long been a fixture throughout Kobe Bryant’s signature line. Here, a breathable mesh upper in black is accented by Volt laces and pops of purple. An external heel counter in bright red is offset by a speckled grey midsole, supported underfoot by an icy translucent rubber outsole.

name: Kobe 9 Elite Low 'University Red'
description: The Nike Kobe 9 Elite Low ‘University Red’ appears with a striking red and black Flyknit upper. The solid black outsole, sockliner, and branding add contrast, while speckled green accents emerge on the laces and midsole. The heel is blocked with a carbon fiber panel while the Swoosh features a glow-in-the-dark makeup.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Shark'
description: Inspired by the characteristics of the shark and how they translate to Kobe Bryant’s performance on court, the Zoom Kobe 7 features an ocean graphic throughout the shoe’s exterior shell that forms a skin-like texture to mimic the look of the predatory creature. A Cushlon midsole allows players to propel their strides with a faster response and protects against harsh impact on the court.

name: Kobe 9 EM 'Dusty Cactus'
description: The Nike Kobe 9 EM appears with a Dusty Cactus hue on the Engineered Mesh upper, which creates a blend of forefoot support and breathability. The red accents on the branding match the Flywire cables, which reinforce the shoe with a locked-down fit. The outsole traction pattern is designed to mirror the shape of an actual foot, with pressure-mapped cushioning pods throughout.

name: Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Black Out'
description: The Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Black Out' features a smooth black leather upper with a matching textured mudguard. The high top sports a padded leather tongue for comfort, Varsity Purple details on the mesh collar, and dark purple accents on the midsole and lining. The sneaker also sports carbon fiber accents along the heel counter, a white wraparound Swoosh on the side, and full-length Zoom Air cushioning in the midsole.

name: Kobe AD NXT FastFit 'Off Noir'
description: The Kobe AD NXT FastFit released on August 24, 2019, displaying Kobe Bryant's obsession with quickness and stability through a high-tech design that offers complete control at high speeds. A FastFit system from the Jordan 33 secures the foot, and the shoe's interior workings can be seen through a translucent Swoosh logo at the side. To take on the repeated impacts of the game, a QuadFit construction and React foam deliver responsive support without extra bulk.

name: Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Carpe Diem'
description: First debuted in 2009, the Nike Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Carpe Diem' sneaker returns in June 2019 to honor the Los Angeles Lakers. Notes of team-inspired colors are seen throughout the synthetic, thermo-molded upper, Swooshes and quilted textile collar. A tongue emblem, snakeskin-textured detailing and a signature on the external heel nod to the legendary player. Lunar foam and Zoom Air cushioning tech combine to energize the rubber outsole.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 'Moon Particle'
description: Following Kobe Bryant’s retirement from the NBA, his signature shoe line still wanted to showcase performance technology as if Kobe was still playing in them. This Kobe A.D. 2018 follows that trend. Although adopting a similar shape to previous designs, it showcases materials and cushioning that offer maximum performance with a lightweight design, with a slip-on construction and a minimalist lacing system. Kobe’s high school and professional jersey numbers—33, 08, 24—appear on the tongue of the left shoe, while his date of birth—08, 23, 78—appears on the right.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 'White Toe'
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. 2018 'White Toe' sneaker, inspired by the namesake athlete's playing style, is engineered with exceptional performance technology for enhanced mobility. The shoe's black exterior is constructed with a mesh bootie upper, Ortholite sockliner and a cord-lacing system to provide an snug, yet supportive fit. The forefoot ripstop band works with the Phylon midsole to provide adaptive security and responsive comfort.

name: Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Del Sol'
description: Not all updates require aesthetic or design changes. Sometimes, improving the technology that goes into the shoe is precisely what that model needs to reboot itself. The Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Del Sol' plays on the retro look of the 1997 Kobe 1 but adds a modern feel by creating the lightest version of the model yet with improved cushioning and a smaller carbon fiber shank. The sneaker boasts a black leather upper with a Varsity Maize knit collar, large white Swoosh branding, and a full-length Zoom midsole.

name: Kobe 10 'Overcome'
description: In the latter part of his NBA career, Kobe Bryant experienced a number of injury-plagued seasons. Nike dropped this ‘Overcome’ edition of the Kobe 10 to recognize Bryant’s resilience. The low-cut sneaker brings a multicolored pattern to the translucent textile upper, while Emerald Glow and Court Purple shades line the Lunarlon sole. A carbon fiber shank is embedded in the forefoot.

name: Kobe 11 GS 'Achilles Heel'
description: In Greek mythology, the Achilles heel is the fatal weak spot of an undefeated warrior. For Kobe Bryant, it refers to his season-ending injury in 2013. As a nod to his recovery, Nike released the Kobe 11 GS 'Achilles Heel.' The sneaker features a Flyknit upper dressed in a University Red and black color scheme,TPU yarn for superior structure and support, and a Zoom unit at the heel for responsive cushioning. The low top also sports a graphic of the God Achilles on the right heel, four stitches on the left heel, and a metallic gold Kobe shield logo on the tongue.

name: Kobe 9 Elite 'Hero'
description: Releasing alongside accompanying LeBron 11 Elite and KD 6 Elite colorways, the Kobe 9 Elite ‘Hero’ completes the thematic Nike Basketball pack. The towering silhouette sports a Wolf Grey knit upper, accented with purple Flywire cables and a matching purple Swoosh. A pop art-inspired camouflage print covers the heel, while a carbon fiber-reinforced midsole gives way to a Lunarlon sole unit.

name: Kobe 11 'Lower Merion'
description: The Nike Kobe 11 ‘Lower Merion’ is a tribute Kobe Bryant’s alma mater, Philadelphia’s Lower Merion High School. Dressed in the school’s colors, the shoe’s Engineered Mesh upper combines Cool Grey, Wolf Grey and Team Red with 3M reflective highlights on the mudguard and eyestay. The low-top shoe includes a Lower Merion Aces logo on the right heel, with Bryant’s signature stitches on the left.

name: Kobe 10 '5AM Flight'
description: The Kobe 10 '5 AM Flight’ was the first colorway for Kobe Bryant’s 10th signature shoe. It references his early morning 40-foot leap from a diving board in August 2013 after recovering from surgery to his Achilles tendon. It features a Vapor Green and Blue Lagoon seamless engineered mesh upper with a snake-scale pattern on the nubuck tongue. The left heel comes accented with four red lines to represent the four feet of stitching required to repair the tendon, while the icy blue translucent outsole features a gold ‘X’ beneath the heel Zoom unit.

name: Kobe 11 'Invisibility Cloak'
description: With the Kobe 11 EM Low ‘Invisibility Cloak,’ Nike revisits a design theme popularized on the Kobe 7. The low-top features a black mesh upper accented with shifting blue and purple hues on the fused paneling, as well as pops of Hyper Pink on the Flywire cables and Kobe logo on the tongue. An icy translucent outsole provides traction, while a drop-in Lunarlon sockliner delivers a cushioned ride.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Eulogy'
description: A tribute to Kobe Bryant’s legendary career, the Nike Kobe 11 'Eulogy' sneaker was one of the final colorways he wore in his last NBA season. Released in February 2016, it sports a Hyper Grape, Black and White colorway that’s inspired by the team colors of the Los Angeles Lakers—the team Bryant played for his entire career. It features a gradient Flyknit upper with a White Swoosh and matching Kobe logo on the tongue. Mismatched heel counters feature red stitching on the left heel and the numbers ‘8’ and ‘24’ on the right—a nod to the jersey numbers he sported while playing.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 Supreme 'Concord'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 7 System Supreme ‘Concord' released in January 2012 with a colorway inspired by the Los Angeles Lakers home uniforms. Supported by two interchangeable insert options that allow for customizable midsole and ankle support, the shoe also features visible Flywire cables in matching Concord. A glass-reinforced composite shank is included in the midsole.

The low-top sports a blacked-out design, featuring a sleek upper constructed from a combination of synthetic and knit materials. Kobe Bryant’s personal logo adorns the tongue, sockliner and translucent outsole. The athlete’s signature is embroidered in red on the heel tab of the right shoe, while its counterpart features a double-helix symbol formed by two intertwined snakes—a nod to the idea of the shoe having Black Mamba DNA.

The low-cut sneaker features a textile and mesh upper above a translucent Lunarlon-cushioned midsole. A carbon fiber shank is embedded on the lateral side of the forefoot, and Kobe Bryant branding appears on the heel and tongue.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 'Purple Gradient'
description: The Nike Zoom Kobe 6 ‘Purple Gradient’ was laced up by Kobe Bryant during the 2011 NBA season. It features a black and Concord gradient on the polyurethane upper, with a snakeskin-textured upper accented by metallic silver on the tongue and side wall Swoosh. It also comes with a black tumbled leather heel panel, a white external heel counter and Zoom Air cushioning in the heel and forefoot.

name: Zoom Kobe 4 POP 'Playoffs'
description: Designed by Eric Avar and Tom Luedecke, the Nike Zoom Kobe 4 was the first Kobe sneaker released in low-top form. The Nike Zoom Kobe 4 POP ‘Del Sol’ dropped in a 2009 Playoff Pack. Featuring a predominantly black and white upper, Del Sol accents emerge on the collar, Swoosh and laces. A custom ‘Playoff Pack’ logo on the tongue features Kobe Bryant’s ‘Mamba’ nickname. The fit is supported by Flywire cables on the upper, a Lunar Foam midsole and Zoom Air cushioning.

name: Kobe 10 'USA'
description: The Kobe 10 ‘USA’ comes alive with a patriotic color scheme, blending an abstract red, white and blue design on the one-piece textile upper. An array of white stars adorns the toe box, while a silver Swoosh covers the quarter panel. The hybrid tooling, which combines Lunarlon cushioning with Nike Free-inspired siping grooves, is encapsulated in a translucent rubber casing for a sleek finish.

The one-piece upper is entirely covered in polyurethane ‘islands’ for enhanced durability, while the resulting scaly texture draws a connection to Kobe Bryant’s Black Mamba persona. Additional performance benefits include supportive Flywire technology, a dual-layer memory foam sockliner and a phylon-injected midsole with Zoom Air units in both the heel and forefoot.

name: Kobe 8 GS 'Christmas'

An Electric Green Swoosh adds to the upper’s aesthetic, while a speckled midsole and gold accents further highlight the look. This grade-school size of the Kobe 8 is also equipped with Lunarlon cushioning.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Tinker Muse'

The shoe's black, grey, and red Flyknit upper features a University Red Swoosh, Cool Grey tongue, all-white sole, and red 'Nike Air' branding on the heel.

Flywire cables and Nike Zoom technology promote a locked-down fit and responsive cushioning.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Graffiti'
description: The Nike Kobe 8 ‘Graffiti’ features a grayscale graffiti print throughout the Engineered Mesh upper, accented by a Flash Lime Swoosh. The lining and heel counter provide additional hits of Flash Lime, while a micro-tread outsole provides traction underfoot. A drop-in full-length Lunarlon midsole provides lightweight cushioning.

The multicolor design is accented by a silver Swoosh and rows of white stars on the toe and medial-side quarter panel. description: The Nike Kobe AD NXT 360 FastFit is designed for consistency and speed. Revealed in November 2019, this Blue Hero update in tie-dye textile boasts innovative lacing for a customized fit, a contouring mesh inner layer and a stabilizing heel clip. A graphic Swoosh to the lateral side, narrative detailing and color-pop accents champion the dynamic look. While the dual-density midsole balances response and resilience, the sneaker's rubber outsole supplies grip in all directions.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Last Emperor'
description: The ‘Last Emperor’ rendition of the Kobe 11 pays tribute to Kobe’s legacy on the court, featuring distinct graphics on the heel that commemorate his NBA accomplishments. A gradient Flyknit construction fades from black to white on the upper, while Flywire cables create a locked-down fit. Cushioning takes the form of a hybrid Lunarlon and Nike Zoom unit.

name: Kobe A.D. Mid BM 'City Edition'
description: Designed with L.A. basketball fans in mind, this Kobe AD ‘Black Mamba’ joined Nike’s ‘City Edition’ pack in late 2017. The Lakers-inspired silhouette features familiar University Gold and black colors along with the words “BLACK” and “MAMBA” on the left and right tongues written in an unmistakable Lakers font. Continuing the team tribute, embroidered drop-shadow Swooshes and a matching outsole are both presented in University Gold.

name: Kobe A.D. Mid 'DeMar DeRozan' PE
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. Mid sneaker gets a double athlete collaboration with the 2018 ‘DeMar DeRozan’ PE model. The Player Exclusive shoe features an insole with a split image mashup of Kobe in his Olympics jersey and DeRozan in his Raptor’s uniform, both sporting the number 10, which is referenced again with the '10/10' emblem on the heel counter. Classic Kobe touches are seen throughout: a snake scale print on the upper for Kobe's nickname ‘Black Mamba’ and the athlete’s signature on the tongue.

name: Kobe 8 'Green Glow'
description: An obvious reptilian theme is showcased on the Nike Kobe 8 ‘Green Glow’ from December 2013. The tongue tag depicts a snake wrapped around Kobe’s personal logo, while a snakeskin print, finished in a blend of Green Glow and Mineral Teal, covers the Engineered Mesh upper. Contrast coloring arrives via pops of Laser Orange on the branding elements and outsole.

name: Kobe A.D. 'Midnight Navy'
description: The Nike Kobe A.D. was created to keep the Mamba storyline alive following his retirement from basketball, featuring a low-profile silhouette that incorporates a combination of Zoom Air and Lunarlon cushioning for responsive and adaptable cushioning. The shoe also incorporates a Dynamic Flywire system to create a secure fit that assists with seamless switching directions on the court.

Using a classic black and white color combo, it debuted contemporary construction consisting of an Engineered Mesh upper with Dynamic Flywire for lockdown support, a Zoom Air-equipped Lunarlon foam midsole, and a grippy outsole micro-tread traction.

The textile mesh upper is finished in Hot Lava, with complementary hits of black on the Swoosh and heel tab. The shoe’s laces, tongue and translucent midsole, which is equipped with a carbon fiber shank, are all done up in a vivid pastel shade that Nike calls Sunset Glow.

name: Kobe 10 Elite 'Mambacurial'
description: Appearing in a low-top design, the Nike Kobe 10 Elite is constructed with a seamless Flyknit upper, featuring the “Mambacurial” color theme inspired by Nike’s iconic soccer cleat. Contrasting black and pink accents line the exterior angles, while the tongue and medial panel appear in a grey hue. Kobe branding appears on the tongue, and a translucent outsole rounds out the contemporary design.

Contrasting Strata Grey makes its way onto the signature Swoosh and rubber outsole, which combines classic herringbone and snake scale-inspired traction patterns.

name: Kobe 11 GS '8 24'
description: Made for big kids, the Nike Kobe 11 GS ‘8 24’ celebrates Kobe Bryant’s legacy with the Los Angeles Lakers. In addition to the Hyper Grape finish on the breathable Flyknit upper, the heel tab on the right shoe is embellished with ‘8’ and ’24,’ the jersey numbers that the Mamba wore during his storied NBA career. Underfoot, an icy translucent rubber outsole reveals the drop-in Lunarlon midsole, equipped with Zoom Air cushioning in the heel.

description: In 2010, Kobe Bryant wore his fifth signature shoe to defeat to Boston Celtics. Seven years later, Nike released a commemorative exclusive in a similar color scheme. The Kobe A.D. 'Big Stage' features an engineered white mesh upper with Flywire technology on the side panels for added support. The low top also boasts metallic gold accents on the side Swoosh, a synthetic reinforcing heel counter, and a padded collar for comfort.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Python'
description: The KOBE 8 System Elite dropped during the 2013 postseason. Designed by Eric Avar, the shoe features Kevlar-reinforced dynamic Flywire technology for a locked-down fit, a thicker engineered mesh upper than the regular season model, an articulated foam tongue for impact protection, and a carbon fiber heel clip for improved stability. This limited release ‘Python’ model celebrates the 2013 Chinese New Year and the ushering of the Year of the Snake. It features a Squadron Green upper with Challenge Red and Legion Brown accents.

name: Kobe A.D. Mid 'Black'
description: This black and white iteration of the Nike Kobe AD Mid is one of seven team colorways released in September 2017. The sneaker features a breathable black mesh upper for comfort atop a white Lunarlon foam midsole with Zoom Air for enhanced energy return.

name: Kobe A.D. 'City of Compton'
description: Inspired by DeRozan’s early memories of watching Kobe Bryant play as a Laker from his hometown in Compton, Demar DeRozan used Kobe’s progression as fuel to motivate his own NBA career. Featuring a tonal grey upper, the shoe is blocked with yellow, purple, and light blue accents throughout the Mamba branding to signify the DeRozan’s earliest recollections of Kobe, where he and the Lakers took on the Utah Jazz in the 1997 Semi-Finals.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 Supreme 'Rice'
description: The Zoom Kobe 6 Supreme ‘Rice’ honors Rice High School, in Harlem, as a part of a group of schools that Kobe sponsors. The Zoom Kobe 6 Supreme 'Rice' features a black and metallic moss-green Polyurethane upper with black nubuck accents on the tongue and heel. The sneaker also boasts Green Apple details on the Swoosh and translucent outsole. A black mamba snakehead is embossed at the heel and Rice High’s logo appears on the medial side.

name: Kobe 9 Elite 'Inspiration'
description: The Kobe 9 Elite ‘Inspiration’ puts a simple colorway on the ultra-high silhouette, with an Anthracite upper contrasted by hits of yellow on the Flyknit upper. Metallic silver on the Swoosh and ankle brings a flash to the look, while the shoe rests on a Lunarlon cushioning unit. Flywire cables are included for support.

name: Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Draft Day'
description: The Kobe 4 marks its retro return in the Zoom Kobe 4 Protro 'Draft Day' sneaker. Released in February 2019 for NBA All-Star Weekend, this shoe is a nod to basketball history. On June 26, 1996, high school senior Kobe Bryant was drafted by the Charlotte Hornets before being traded to the Los Angeles Lakers—a move that changed the course of Bryant’s life and two NBA franchises. A White, Orion Blue and Varsity Purple color palette and the draft date embossed on the heel pay tribute to this pivotal moment in basketball history.

name: Kobe AD 'Black Gum'
description: The Kobe AD ‘Black Gum’ is designed with a sleek black Flyknit upper blocked with gold accents on the eyelets, branding, and Swoosh. Resting on a white midsole, this shoe is also contrasted with a gum outsole and additional Mamba logos on the tongue, heel, and insoles.

A pair of Mamba logos appear on the heel where Kobe’s signature and the Ducks’ logo are also displayed. Coupled with a Zoom Air unit and Lunarlon cushioning system, the silhouette is designed to soften harsh impact, while promoting a quick response.

Full-length Lunarlon midsole cushioning and a Zoom heel unit energize the translucent rubber outsole.

name: Kobe 9 Elite 'Christmas'

The sneaker sports red and white accents on the Flyknit upper that match the swirl of the outsole pattern that is inspired by Christmas stocking colors. Equipped with Flywire technology on the lacing for a more stable midfoot feel, the silhouette is contrasted with a black Swoosh and Mamba branding, while the sock-like design provides a snug fit.

name: Kobe 10 GS 'Blackout'
description: Like the men’s version, the Kobe 10 GS ‘Blackout’ is inspired by Kobe Bryant’s rigorous workout routine. Persian Violet coloring, inspired by the only team Kobe played for, finishes both the seamless textile upper and translucent rubber midsole. The latter houses a hybrid cushioning system made up of full-length Lunarlon foam and a Zoom Air unit in the heel. Underfoot, a uniquely textured outsole delivers enhanced traction on the court.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System Elite 'Home'

Reflective chrome detailing on the shoe’s tongue and speckled midsole complement the grey outsole underneath.

name: Kobe A.D. Mid 'Game Royal'
description: Nike continues to expand on the Kobe A.D. silhouette’s legacy with new lightweight and monochromatic colorways. The Kobe A.D. Mid 'Game Royal' features a breathable Game Royal mesh upper with molded foam details on the collar and tongue for added comfort. The sneaker also sports Flywire cables for support and a Lunarlon foam midsole with a Zoom Air unit for responsive cushioning.

For the Nike Vault release in Los Angeles, the Nike Kobe 10 Elite Low 'Christmas' arrived with special gold packaging lined in red and five branded hang tags.

Its lightweight mesh upper features a blend of black and Bright Crimson, with the latter hue also showcased on the signature Swoosh and laces. model: Zoom Kobe Venomenon 4 'Glow In The Dark'

Its mesh upper is primarily black, with a rich red lining the collar, tongue, and heel branding. The heel is outfitted with a synthetic overlay that boasts a glistening purple hue. At the bottom, the shoe is underscored by a glow-in-the-dark sole which gives the sneaker its name.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Achilles Heel'
description: The Nike Kobe 11 ‘Achilles Heel’ sneaker is released in a black and red gradient colorway for January 2016, paying respect to the Greek god, Achilles, and Kobe’s season-ending surgery in 2013. The upper introduces an even stronger version of Flyknit technology, fused with TPU threads for extra elasticity and resistance to oil, grease and abrasion. The high-performance design boasts a full-length Lunarlon foam and Air Zoom unit, with an embossed graphic of Achilles on the right heel counter.

A patent leather upper blends well with the Flywire panels, and both of Kobe's jersey numbers, 8 and 24, can be seen on the back heel of the shoe.

name: Zoom Kobe 6 'Barcelona Home'
description: Designed by Eric Avar, the Nike Zoom Kobe 6 was worn by Kobe Bryant during the 2010-2011 NBA season. The upper sports a textured polyurethane construction inspired by snakeskin, recalling Bryant’s ‘Black Mamba’ nickname, which is supported by a Phylon-injected midsole and Zoom Air units in the heel and forefoot. The Kobe 6 ‘Barcelona’ sports the home colors of Spanish soccer club FC Barcelona, a tribute to Bryant’s passion for soccer while growing up in Italy.

name: Kobe 10 Elite 'Drill Sergeant'
description: The militaristic look of the ‘Drill Sergeant’ Kobe 10 Elite Low pays homage to words of advice the Lakers shooting guard received from veteran players in regards to the ineffectiveness of shouting at teammates like a ‘drill sergeant.’ The shoe sports a gradient teal upper with bright orange accents at the Swoosh, Flywire, and midsole speckling under an icy overlay.

name: Kobe A.D. 2018 'Black Toe'
description: NBA legend Kobe Bryant teams up with Nike for another collaborative signature shoe, the Kobe A.D. 'Black Toe' sneaker. Released in November 2018, the color-blocked shoe is dressed in white, with a Nike Swoosh on its lateral side and in black with Kobe’s signature logo on its medial side. The front and back exterior is accented with a capped toe and Kobe Bryant branding. The outsole also receives the two-tone treatment, completed with a translucent heel.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Olympic'

The Kobe 7 System comes with two interchangeable insert options: Attack Fast, with a Phylon midsole and Nike Zoom units in the forefoot and heel, and Attack Strong, with a full-length Cushlon midsole and padded ankle cuff. Other support features include Kevlar Flywire cables and a carbon fiber external heel counter.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 System 'Cheetah'
description: Paying tribute to Kobe Bryant’s killer instincts, the Nike Zoom Kobe 7 System ‘Cheetah’ features a Cheetah print on its black cast polyurethane upper and Medium Grey accents throughout. The shoe also comes equipped with Flywire technology and a 3-D heel clip for lock-down support. Underfoot, the low top features a Phylon midsole with Nike Zoom units in the forefoot and a glass reinforced composite shank in the midsole.

name: Kobe 8 System SS 'Christmas'
description: Following the silhouette’s lineage of Christmas-themed colorways, the Nike Kobe 8 SS features a scaly upper design with translucent grey tones throughout the seamless overlays. Its textured look is reminiscent of a snakeskin shedding, while a Christmas ornament design is featured on the lace-lock. Contrasted with a green outsole and Swoosh, the silhouette also features the classic Mamba branding throughout the tongue with Kobe’s signature on the heel.

name: Kobe 10 'Silk'
description: As a tribute to Kobe Bryant’s international life story, Nike released the ‘Silk’ edition of the Kobe 10 in 2015, named as a reference to the Silk Road, the historic trade network that connected Europe and Asia. The low-cut sneaker features a textile and mesh upper, a Lunarlon cushioned midsole and a carbon fiber shank in the lateral forefoot. name: Kobe 10 Elite 'Draft Pick'

The sneaker also boasts a contrasting white Swoosh and a translucent sole unit.

name: Kobe 11 '3D'

Released in July 2016, it sports an allover spotted pattern that pairs Total Crimson and Chlorine Blue hues together for a 3D effect on its engineered mesh upper. Alternating red and blue Swoosh branding on its sidewall complement the mismatched heel counters, while an icy translucent midsole and outsole complete the look.

name: Kobe 11 Elite Low 'Black History Month'

This rendition showcases a multi-color gradient pattern on its lightweight, breathable Flyknit upper, with BHM logos decorating the tongue padding and insoles. As the final signature sneaker for Kobe’s playing career, the Kobe 11 features special performance details are seen in the full-length Lunarlon foam and Nike Zoom Air, working to absorb shock and maximize cushioning and responsiveness.

name: Zoom Kobe Icon

A mirror-like finish on the molded heel counter is meant to symbolize the period of reflection that Kobe endured following his injury-plagued 2012-2013 season. The unique design is finished with a vibrant pop of Volt on the Swoosh, as well as gradient shades of red and purple on the outsole.

The low-profile sneaker rides on an icy translucent rubber outsole, which reveals a drop-in midsole that combines plush Lunarlon with a responsive Zoom Air unit in the heel.

name: Kobe 6 GS 'White Del Sol'

Released in 2011, this kids' sized shoe possesses a colorway of white, black, Del Sol and Neutral Grey, and features a snakeskin-like design on its upper. Part of Nike’s 2016 Kobe 11 Muse Pack, this special edition Kobe 11 Elite Low ‘Mark Parker’ was designed by the Nike CEO. It features a black and blue remixed Flyknit pattern and an embossed textured snakeskin panel on the heel. Cushioning is provided by Lunarlon and Nike Zoom Air technologies, while the outsole reveals a translucent application underfoot.

name: Zoom Kobe 7 Supreme 'Christmas'

The Zoom Kobe 7 Supreme 'Christmas' features a Violet Pop upper with cheetah print and Volt Flywire cables for structure. name: Zoom Kobe 5 'Prelude'
description: Released in Nike’s Prelude Pack in January 2014, the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 'Prelude' celebrates Kobe Bryant’s impact on popular culture with a pop art-inspired colorway. The multicolor upper features Flywire technology for a locked-down fit, while the gold Swoosh serves as a tribute to the championship ring Bryant won while wearing the Kobe 5. It also comes with purple speckling on the black midsole and a glow-in-the-dark outsole underfoot.

name: Kobe 8 System 'Christmas'

Combined with no-sew synthetic overlays and a Lunarlon sole, the 2012 release is an exceptionally lightweight sneaker. To celebrate Christmas that same year, Nike dropped this festive rendition of the Kobe 8 System, complete with a bold, colorful upper inspired by the rhinoceros viper.

name: Zoom Kobe 5 'Big Stage Home'
description: Kobe Bryant wore the Nike Zoom Kobe 5 ‘Big Stage Home’ during the 2010 NBA Finals en route to his fifth NBA championship ring. The shoe features a white upper with an allover tattoo-style graphic showcasing the high points of Kobe’s season alongside gold accents. Stats highlighted on the upper include his 25,207 total career points, which he achieved on February 1, 2010 to help him become the Lakers’ all-time leading scorer.

name: Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Mamba Day'

April 13 is a day of celebration for all things Kobe, and this Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Mamba Day’ serves as the centerpiece for 2018. Featuring a black leather upper with metallic gold accents and premium suede overlays on the toe, tongue, and heel, special details include the ‘4.13.18’ release date on the back right heel, ‘XX’ on the lace fixtures representing Kobe’s 20 years with the LA Lakers, and custom insoles that show him walking out to the court for his last game.

This ‘Orange County’ edition features an all-over graphic using brilliant orange, yellow and red hues to depict a Southern California sunset. An illustrated starfish on the sockliner and contrasting pops of teal on the Swoosh, heel and outsole add to the coastal design theme.

The Charlotte Hornets-inspired color scheme features a white base, Varsity Purple on the Flywire cables and Swoosh and turquoise accents throughout, including the outsole. A translucent Emerald Green midsole conceals a carbon fiber midfoot shank, while four red stripes—signifying Bryant’s 2013 Achilles injury—appear on the left shoe only.

name: Kobe 10 Elite High 'What The'
description: Released in December 2015, the Nike Kobe 10 Elite High 'What The' features a multi-colored Flyknit upper, reflective silver Swoosh, speckled midsole, and translucent outsole.

name: Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Final Seconds'
description: The Zoom Kobe 1 Protro 'Final Seconds' celebrates Kobe Bryant’s heroic performance in Game 4 of the 2006 first round Western Conference Playoffs against the Suns. In the 4th quarter, Bryant hit a last-second one-handed layup to tie the game and take it into overtime. The Lakers then found themselves down by one point with 6.1 seconds left on the clock. Again, the Lakers got the ball to Bryant from a tip, and he drove across the court to the right and drained a game-winner over two defenders to beat the buzzer and seal a famous 99-98 win, and a 3-1 series lead. Based on the Lakers’ home-team jerseys from that season, the colorway sports a white leather upper with Del Sol and Varsity Purple accents. It also features Kobe’s number 8 jersey number embroidered on the heels and a full-length Zoom Air sole. The shoe was part of the Nike, Converse, and Jordan ‘Art of the Champion’ pack, a 16-shoe collection celebrating 16 iconic performances by 16 of the game’s greatest champions.

This ‘What The Kobe’ model, inspired by the mash-up concept first introduced by Nike SB in 2007, blends together several different Kobe 7 colorways including the Mamba Snake, Cheetah, Poison Dart Frog, and Shark. Other details include Kevlar Flywire technology and a carbon fiber external heel counter.

description: Distributed strictly to friends and family in 2016, the Air Jordan 3/8 Retro ‘Kobe Pack’ was designed to commemorate Kobe Bryant’s illustrious NBA career. The two-piece set brings together Lakes-inspired colorways of the Air Jordan 3 and 8, replicating two of the iconic PE models that the Mamba wore during the 2002-03 season, a period in which the athlete was essentially a sneaker free agent. The Air Jordan 3 utilizes a white tumbled leather upper with grey elephant-print overlays at the toe and heel. A gold Jumpman outlined in purple is embroidered on the tongue, complementing a second Jumpman logo on the molded heel tab. The Air Jordan 8 features similar color blocking, highlighted by a white leather upper with contrasting purple and gold accents throughout.
